snippet: Hunting tools from 71,000 years ago found in South Africa suggest modern humans with a well-developed capacity for abstract thought and a grasp of complex technologies, a new study concludes.
abstract: Kyle S Brown study in journal Nature reports discovery of advanced stone hunting tools in rock shelter in South Africa; finding lends weight to hypothesis that early anatomically modern humans had capacity for abstract thought and grasp of complex technologies.
lead_paragraph: Hunting tools from 71,000 years ago found in South Africa suggest modern humans with a well-developed capacity for abstract thought and a grasp of complex technologies, a new study concludes.

headline.seo: Stone Tools Point to Creative Work by Early Humans in Africa
headline.main: Stone Tools Point to Creative Work by Early Humans in Africa
headline.print_headline: Stone Tools Point to Creative Work by Early Humans in Africa
